answers.answer: I wouldn't call the insertion of a Defib device surgery but a procedure.  There must be reason to suggest the Defib, and CHF is an excellent reason to put away your fears and listen objectively for the reason.  None of us can really advise you, in my opinion.  That said, I sure enjoy a dependable heart beat.  One of my exercise buddies and I debate this three days a week.  He fears that the defib devise will compromise his wish to simply pass if he has total heart failure, and it certainly is a good argument against the procedure.
I reposted this in the chf forum. I will be getting a biventricular icd next week. Wish me luck.

question: I am a 62 yr old woman with diabetes, chf and ckd. I recently had a heart cath and there were no blockages. I will be seeing another dr abt a defibrillator in a few days. I have been adamantly against surgery, if that's an option, but have recently been giving it considerable thought. I have a left bundle branch block. Any thoughts please.
title: Defibrillator or surgery?
